ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Hymn/Mana song macro
ygData.msgSnippet: Ahh! that was it! Heh, forgot to extend the length of singing clarity. I didn t have any problems not having the pause after the stopsong command, however.
ygData.messageBody:
Ahh! that was it! Heh, forgot to extend the length of singing clarity.

I didn't have any problems not having the "pause" after the "stopsong"
command, however. But it's best to test it on your system dependent on the
amount of lag you face.

Nice job Kit!

---Windleaf

At 03:17 PM 11/17/00 -0700, Kimes, Dean W. wrote:
>I think that mine is:
>
>/pause 31, /cast <heal>
>/pause 2, /stopsong
>/pause 61, /cast <clarity>
>/pause 2, /stopsong
>/em taps his foot to the beat
>
>to allow two pulses of clarity before starting anew. The tapping lets me
>know it's time to hit the button again.
>
> Kit
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: John Tatsukawa [mailto:john@...]
>Sent: Friday, November 17, 2000 3:12 PM
>To: eqbards@egroups.com; 'eqbards@egroups.com'
>Subject: RE: [eqbards] Hymn/Mana song macro
>
>
>I believe this is what I have for my downtime setup. You might have to
>tweak the pause time.
>
>/pause 30, /cast <heal>
>/stopsong
>/pause 30, /cast <clarity>
>/stopsong
>/pause 30, /cast <clarity>
>
>Though with this, you'll have to manually turn off clarity before you
>restart your macro. I thought I had a better way to do it, but I wiped my
>opt files a little while back due to crashes, so I'll have to re-think this
>though.
>
>---Windleaf
>
>At 01:53 PM 11/17/00 -0700, Kimes, Dean W. wrote:
> >Have to look it up tonite Galtin, have one but it isn't memorized any more.
> >
> > Kit
> >
